description: Students analyze from a broadly cultural view the political, religious, and intellectual debates of
Chaucer's day as reflected in his greatest work, the Canterbury Tales. Students examine the
Canterbury Tales through the lens of ethics, using readings in ethical theory to better
understand moral questions, Chaucer's poetry, and ourselves -- as interpreters of literature and
